results.title: This marching girl thing
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Kelli Simpson
results.brief_description: Cindy (Toni Collette), a baton twirler with the Southern Twirlettes is competing in the Victorian Baton Twirlers competition, her girlfriend Alison (Jenny Apostolou), and boyfriend Peter (Matt Day) in tow. As the results are announced, she questions whether she should continue pursuing “this marching girl thing”, and whether she should continue with Alison or Peter.

results.title: This man
results.creator_credit: J.N. Bagnall, Australian Board of Missions and Keith Laxton
results.brief_description: This film is about the impact of Western culture on the people of the Pacific. It tells of the Melanesian’s loss of a sense of identity and meaning, and the disappearance of the old ways that gave happiness and security. It is often angry and bitter, but is not without hope, for the man of Melanesia is determined to find the way out of his confusion and despair. Based on a Melanesian play by Francis Bugotu and Tony Hughes.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.brief_description: In 1912, Dandy Hams and Bacon commenced at premises located in Dandenong, Melbourne. This short film is a rare record of Dandenong’s first major industry and features reminiscences by Maurie Jarvis (filmmaker Sue Jarvis’s father) who worked at Dandy from the age of 15 until he retired, first as a truck driver and then as a Sales Manager. Now aged 86 Maurie remembers quite fondly of his time at the Dandy Bacon Factory and talks about its operations and processes to a background of rare archival images of the factory buildings, its machinery and its workers. Sadly none of these buildings now exist.

results.title: This life
results.brief_description: ‘This life’ - the series following the life and loves of twenty something solicitors, Anna, Miles, Milly, Egg and Warren earned itself a legion of loyal fans when it originally screened in 1997. Series devised by Amy Jenkins.

results.title: This is your stop! (April 2006)
results.brief_description: A trip through time and space: from ancient Egypt to the wild, wild west. This green screen workshop was produced as part of the G.A.T.E.ways (gifted and talented education) program for kids. The year 6 students learnt scripting, production and performance skills using virtual set technology.

results.title: This is your museum speaking
results.creator_credit: David Verrall, ONF | NFB and Lynn Smith
results.brief_description: This short animated film tells the story of a night watchman who, with his dog, Fang, discovers that museums are not morgues, that they are very much a part of the community. With humor, the film shows how our present is connected to the past.

results.title: This is your lung
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Film Producers Guild and Oswald Skilbeck
results.brief_description: Designed to discourage cigarette smoking. Uses a smoking machine to show a variety of foreign matter in cigarette smoke, including a cancer-causing tar. Deals with a patient who has a smoker’s cough, but is ultimately found to be suffering from lung cancer.
